wikipedia_page.main: Charles Francis Buller (26 May 1846 – 22 November 1906) was a cricketer who was born in Colombo, Ceylon, but played his cricket for Middlesex and the Marylebone Cricket Club. An alumnus of Harrow School whose father William also played first-class cricket for the MCC, Buller was a right-handed batsman and occasional right-handed round arm bowler. Over his career from 1864 to 1877 he scored 3,140 runs at a batting average of 21.80, with two centuries.
